channel.title: All the tech news

item.title: New general-purpose Amazon EC2 M8i and M8i Flex instances are now available
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting news for cloud users! Amazon has launched the M8i and M8i-Flex EC2 instances powered by Intel Xeon processors. These new instances offer up to 15% better price performance and 20% higher performance than previous generations. They‚Äôre designed for general workloads like web applications, databases, and AI models. M8i instances also provide enhanced network and EBS bandwidth, improving performance across various applications. #AmazonEC2 #CloudComputing #TechUpdates #AWS #IntelXeon

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Channy Yun (Ïú§ÏÑùÏ∞¨)
Category: product_announcements

item.title: How to use Lakebase as a transactional data layer for Databricks Apps
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Explore how to effectively use Lakebase as a transactional data layer for Databricks Apps. The article discusses the integration of Lakebase in building internal tools and AI applications. It highlights key strategies for optimizing data management and enhancing application performance. For developers and data professionals, this approach can streamline processes and improve efficiency. #Databricks #Lakebase #DataManagement #AI #TechSolutions üåäüìäüíª

item.title: Ethical Hacking Challenge: Decode the Server Heist, Defend Your Digital Data
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üõ°Ô∏è Learn about SQL Injection (SQLi) attacks and their impact on database security. These attacks exploit application vulnerabilities to manipulate SQL queries, leading to unauthorized access and data theft. Consequences include credential theft, data alteration, and even system access. Stay informed and protect your digital data! üîê #CyberSecurity #EthicalHacking #SQLInjection #DataProtection #TechAwareness

Source: Cisco Developer Blog
Author: Francois Caen
Category: educational

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA 2025.1.5 Is Out!
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ IntelliJ IDEA has released update v2025.1.5! You can easily update from the IDE, Toolbox App, or download it from the website. Key improvements include better performance during Google Meet screen sharing on macOS with a second monitor and enhancements to UrlClassLoader.getFiles. For details on resolved issues, check the release notes. Happy coding! üíª‚ú® #IntelliJIDEA #SoftwareUpdate #Programming #DeveloperTools #TechNews

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Julia Shashkova
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Getting Started with NVIDIA Isaac for Healthcare Using the Telesurgery Workflow
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Telesurgery is transforming healthcare delivery as the shortage of surgeons rises. With advancements in 5G and AI, experts can now operate remotely, shifting from experimental to essential. üåç NVIDIA Isaac for Healthcare offers a modular workflow that includes video streaming, robot control, and simulation tools. This enables seamless training and clinical deployment. Learn how this technology is paving the way for the next generation of surgical robotics. ü§ñüí° #Telesurgery‚Ä¶

Source: Nvidia Developer Blog
Author: Michael Zephyr
Category: educational

item.title: Moving the public Stack Overflow sites to the cloud: Part 1
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Stack Overflow is transitioning from physical servers to the cloud! This move marks a significant shift from their traditional data center model, primarily based in the US. The journey began with Stack Overflow for Teams successfully migrating to Azure, but challenges remain for the public site. üåê Key project deadlines are set for July 31, 2025, coinciding with the data center‚Äôs closure. The team is focused on setting milestones to ensure a smooth transition while maintaining flexibility‚Ä¶

Source: Stack Overflow Blog
Author: Wouter de Kort, Joseph Schwanz
Category: technical_deep_dives

item.title: A deeper look at AI crawlers: breaking down traffic by purpose and industry
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üåê Cloudflare Radar is enhancing AI insights with new industry-focused data on bot traffic. The article discusses how traditional search platforms are affected by the rise of AI. Users often find answers without clicking through to original sources, impacting ad revenue for publishers. New features include a breakdown of AI bot traffic by purpose, such as training and user action, allowing for better understanding of these trends. üìäü§ñ #AIBotTraffic #CloudflareRadar #DigitalMarketing‚Ä¶

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: David Belson
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: Evaluating image segmentation models for background removal for Images
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ This week, the Images team introduced background removal using dichotomous image segmentation models on Workers AI. We evaluated several models to efficiently isolate subjects from their backgrounds. Image segmentation involves dividing an image into meaningful parts, with salient object detection highlighting the most prominent areas. The focus was on creating a soft saliency mask, assigning pixel values to indicate foreground and background. This allows for accurate predictions across‚Ä¶

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Diretnan Domnan
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Make Your Website Conversational for People and Agents with NLWeb and AutoRAG
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Transform your website with NLWeb and Cloudflare‚Äôs AutoRAG! üåê‚ú® This new approach shifts from traditional keyword searches to a conversational model, helping users and AI agents find answers more effectively. NLWeb, developed by Microsoft, standardizes natural-language queries, while AutoRAG manages content retrieval seamlessly. Together, they make websites AI-ready, improving user experience and opening new monetization opportunities for publishers. #WebInnovation #ConversationalAI #NLWeb‚Ä¶

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Anni Wang
Category: educational

item.title: The age of agents: cryptographically recognizing agent traffic
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üåê Cloudflare has introduced Web Bot Auth, allowing websites to differentiate between verified bots and agents. This new system supports the growing demand for granular control over bot traffic, helping to block malicious bots while enabling helpful ones. The classification includes agents that act on behalf of users, enhancing interactions like booking flights or ordering food. Stay updated on the evolving bot landscape! ü§ñ‚ú® #WebSecurity #BotTraffic #Cloudflare #VerifiedBots #AIagents

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Jin-Hee Lee
Category: product_announcements
